Reviews.Title: “Just okay...”
Reviews.Author: NAUgrad2005
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights as part of a travel package, and all in all, the hotel was fine. PROS: -Easy to find off of the Grande Raccorde Annualare (GRA) ring highway -There's a bus stop just outside the gates of the hotel that connects with the Metro line to access downtown Rome -Free parking -Decent breakfast, though sometimes not well restocked CONS: -On the far east side of Rome...roughly 30 minutes away from the Termini Metro stop -WiFi access for 1 euro per hour, not a very strong signal -Beds are ridiculously hard, sheets were not changed during our entire stay -Shower had some mold along the bottom edge -The room was so hot! No ability to adjust room temperature...be prepared to roast! The desk staff was friendly and spoke English, which was helpful when asking directions. We thought the breakfast was decent, with cereals, yogurt, some meat and juices. There were several times that the milk for cereal was room temperature and the juice was frequently out. All in all, I thought it was an okay hotel. It suited our needs fairly well, although the hotel could definitely stand to upgrade the mattresses and pillows. I felt like I was sleeping on a box springs!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but be prepared to commute!”
Reviews.Author: Travellingkatieg
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good value for money, despite the residential, slightly worn down area, this hotel is nice and modern and set back off the main road. Very secure with a pass code gate at the entrance. The room did have a very noisy radiator so we did have to turn it off. The hotel also double booked us, so we had to spend our first night at the alba, then we're transferred on our second night, then transferred back on our third! Slightly annoying however the hotel were very apologetic and paid for our taxis to the knew hotel, which was very nice and at no cost to us! You must be prepared to commute to the city! However it is very easy and very cheap and the hotel gave us a map and directions. Overall can't complain as the price is low! Wouldn't probably stay here again, as it's just a bit toot far out for me, but would still recommend for a cheap break.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: any-nadine
Reviews.Content: We have just came back from a 3 days city break spent in Rome. Alba Hotel was really nice for the money paid ; it's true that's a little bit far from the city center, but at about 50 m from the hotel you find the bus station. Take bus 558 1 stop to Ciamarra Rizzieri, than bus 20 or 511 3 stops to the stop Anagnina and from here you have direct metro line till Vaticano or Termini, so is not so complicated as it seems. The location is very quiet, rooms are very, very big and clean. They have big bathrooms, towels are changed dialy, safe box in room, LCD TV(not so big). The only real problem are the very thin walls which provide very bad phonic isolation. Breakfast is tipical italian, with some cheese, ham, panini, cakes, cereals, milk, tea, coffee, really good to start the day. All in all was a good experience which I recommend to other peole visiting Rome. Enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “very good for this price”
Reviews.Author: mariana m
Reviews.Content: Clean and nice hotel. We enjoy our 5 nights .If you want to visite Rome, then i supose thath the distance from bus station , direct from Termini Station (Bus 105,35 minute ) about 5 minute to walk is not a problem. No free WIFI acces either in the lobby very good for this price !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: saunierman
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this place on Friday 16th Sept and promptly checked out on the 17th! The place was a danger zone: sockets hanging off walls, lights not working, etc. Being a Gas and Electrical engineer, if this was Britain I could have issued a notice to shut them down! The Breakfast was a total insult. On informing the gardener, come janitor, come receptionist that we were leaving, he informed us that, despite paying for 4 nights and only staying one, we would have to pay the city tax for the 4 nights. We refused and he threatened us with the police, which we gladly welcomed. He then changed his mind and told us to clear off. Very professional! As we were leaving, another couple were checking out and they told us that they had spent two nights, having booked for the week but that they couldn't suffer any more. I would like to point out that we maintained our dignity at all times (we are English after all ;) ) unlike this hyperventillating marrionette that fronted the desk. This hotel is miles from anywhere and should remain there! We then booked the Radisson Blu in Rome .Welcome civiilzation!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for stay at Rome”
Reviews.Author: JYOTILAHIRI
Reviews.Content: On a trip to Europe along with other 45 members ( Through Voyager`s Club - a Tour Operator from Kolkata ) we stayed in this hotel for 1 night on 19th May 2011. Our stay was very enjoyable room was comfortable , complimentary beak fast was good and hotel staff was friendly. I shall recommend this to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very far from the city centre!!!”
Reviews.Author: lerrassa
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our tour group in this hotel. The hotel was too far from the centre of the city. Service was poor and the staff unconcerned. Wi-fi was not free. If I had a chance I wouldn't stay there...

Reviews.Title: “Great place if u want to be in a quiet location near Rome”
Reviews.Author: Julitha
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there during our 5 day trip to Rome, as we were travelling with our mum we did not want to stay in the city centre. Great place if u r looking for a comfortable stay, 30 minutes by bus/metro to city centre and ciampiono airport. Friendly staff speaks English

Reviews.Title: “nice but lots of problems”
Reviews.Author: hellodubrovnik
Reviews.Content: this is a nice hotel, a lot newer comparing to the average Rome hotels. but the rooms are not very nice, there was no place in the shower to put your shampoo, no air conditioning, housekeeping was very bad, we were there for 5 nights and the bed sheets weren't changed even once! the real problem was it was very loud! in the room next to us there was a man and all his sound, his TV, his talking on the phone was all in our ears, we couldn't sleep, i asked the reception to warn the man every night but they did nothing. i literally got no sleep, and i was frustrated. the second thing is this hotel is the most far hotel to the center i have ever been. it was first a bus to the metro station and then 13 stops to termini. and termini is not the center, if you want to go to Vatican, you should know that you have to leave the hotel 1.5 hours prior to the time you want to be there. i am sorry but i think you can find a better hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, fantastic links to the city”
Reviews.Author: MegG360
Reviews.Content: When arriving at the hotel with my friend, we were a little unsure due to its location. But, after passing through the security gate and entering the hotels reception area, we were both very pleasantly surprised. The check in process was fairly quick and simple enough, with the staff being polite and very helpful. We took our luggage into the lift, and went up to our room on the first floor. We were immediately blown away by the size of the room! (After being in a cramped Parisian hotel room for a week, the new found space was luxury!) The room was well equipped and exactly as described. WiFi was 2 euros per hour (if I remember rightly) and prices for drinks from the mini bar were very reasonable. The breakfast was a basic, continental style ( bread, cheeses, yoghurt, cereals and coffee) but in plentiful supply. On occasion, we would hear some noise from other guests in the morning, but otherwise, the hotel was quiet. The rooms were kept clean and the bedding was changed every other day. As for location and getting into the city? The shop-come-bar-come-pizzeria over the road sells the 'metrebus' tickets for 1 euro each, and the bus stop is right outside the hotel. The bus goes through the urban area and stops at the metro station Subaugusta, which is on the main A line, that runs to Termini and sights such as the colosseum and through to the vatican city. All in all, getting the bus to the metro station and then getting the metro into the city takes less than an hour. It may be a bit too far out for some people, but for sightseeing on a budget it worked for me! And as value for money goes, I think that Alba Hotel takes the cake and it worked with my tiny budget perfectly! I would definitely return, despite the short commute.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for a Trip to Rome but be Prepared for Commute”
Reviews.Author: CityBreakCouple_9
Reviews.Content: My partner had business in the area so he asked me to find a hotel on the eastern side of the city, I read so many terrible reviews of hotels in this area (which is a bit dodgy to be honest!) but the ones for Alba Hotel werent too bad so we went for it. The best thing about the hotel is the value for money that it offers, the reception and breakfast staff were also very good and friendly. All other factors were distinctly average but its important to say that the room was kept very clean. So as long as you are prepared to make the daily commute into the city - 5 minutes by bus that arrives right outside hotel, and maybe 25 minutes after that by metro - you will get very good value for money here which has to be a big factor when staying in very expensive Roma!

HotelInfo.Name: Alba Hotel Torre Maura
HotelInfo.Address: Viale di Torre Maura, 81, 00169 Rome, Italy
